issues.description: Constructor parameter order in the solution does not follow the order required by the problem statement/UML. The exercise explicitly asks students to implement a constructor that initializes attributes in the same order as in the UML (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors). The solution's constructor signature is: Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents) which uses a different parameter order. This discrepancy can confuse students about the expected constructor signature and can cause automated tests (or student expectations) that check parameter order to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor parameter order consistent with the UML and problem statement. Change the solution constructor signature to: public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors) and assign the fields accordingly. Alternatively, if the different order in the solution was intentional, update the problem statement (and template/tests) to document and require that exact parameter order so students are not confused.
